sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: President Xi Jinping says that China and the U.S. have reached agreement on a number of issues during Secretary of State Antony Blinken's visit to Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Burials have begun for those brutally killed by militants in Uganda on Friday in the worst massacre the country has seen since 2010.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian shelling in Ukraine's flooded city of Kherson leaves vehicles engulfed in flames and heaps further strain on residents and emergency services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Chinese President Xi Jinping gave a positive assessment of a meeting in Beijing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: with the U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He was quoted as saying the two sides have also made progress and reached agreement on some specific issues. This is very good.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Blinken's two-day visit is the highest level trip to China by U.S. official since President Joe Biden took office. In earlier meetings between Blinken and senior Chinese officials, the two sides expressed willingness to talk, but showed little inclination to bend on hardened positions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tensions have been particularly acute over U.S. congressional delegations visiting Taiwan and China's refusal to condemn Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: White House officials downplayed expectations of any significant developments from Blinken's visit, but it does pave the way for further contacts and possibly even a meeting between Biden and Xi in the coming months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Grieving families have begun burying their dead in western Uganda while others search

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: desperately for missing loved ones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It follows Friday's brutal attack by militants who killed dozens of pupils housed in two dormitories in a co-ed secondary school.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Officials say at least 41 people were massacred and half a dozen kidnapped in the worst attack of its kind in Uganda since 2010. Some students were burned beyond recognition, others were shot or hacked to death with machetes. The attack has been blamed on the Allied Democratic Forces or ADF which has established ties with the Islamic State. They are largely based in the neighboring Democratic Republic of the Congo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In response, Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni has vowed to send more troops to the unstable border region between Uganda and the DRC.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The raids appear to have taken the Ugandan authorities by surprise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: First responders only arrived after the attackers had left. Fires broke out in the city of Kherson on Sunday night after Russian missiles targeted

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: the war-torn eastern city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Shelling left a dozen buses engulfed in flames and a rescue service excavator destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Emergency services here are overwhelmed after the collapse of the Kharkovska Dam on 6th June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Dozens of villages are flooded and thousands of people are in need of assistance every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But access to food and water is just one of many concerns felt by residents here. It's scary to go there. There are pumps there to pump water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's scary to go there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UN has accused Russia of blocking access to flood-hit areas under its occupation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Elsewhere, Ukraine says it has regained more than 100 square kilometers of territory since its counteroffensive began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Moscow claims that seven civilians were wounded in Ukrainian shelling in Russia's Belgorod border region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Germany is strengthening its role within NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Days after approving the first national security strategy, which envisages the highest military expenditure since the Second World War, the German Chancellor wants to make clear to its Secretary-General the importance of the military alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Stoltenberg has welcomed Germany's plans to spend 2 percent of GDP on defense by 2024 and referred to the ongoing war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine has the right to liberate its own land and a counteroffensive is now underway. The more land the Ukrainians are able to liberate, the stronger their hand will eventually be at the negotiating table. The two leaders spoke of the upcoming NATO summit in Vilnius, which will not result in a formal invitation to Kiev to join the alliance. Global warming is advancing faster than expected in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: An annual report by the World Meteorological Organization and the European Copernicus Network says the average temperature on the continent is 2.3 degrees warmer than it was at the end of the 19th century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: This overheating doubles the global average and fuels exceptional heat waves and droughts. As can be seen in this graph, warming has soared since the 1990s, breaking temperature records on several occasions. The heating has been uneven geographically, reaching around 2 degrees above average in much of Western Europe and even exceeding 3.5 degrees in regions close to the Arctic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Summer last year was the hottest on record in many European countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The report says extreme weather-related events have claimed more than 16,000 lives and directly affected 156,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some 200 people in the Greek port city of Piraeus marched to the offices of Frontex and the Hellenic Guard on Sunday, protesting their handling of last week's deadly shipwreck off the coast of Pylos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There are mounting questions as to whether the Greek Coast Guard should have intervened earlier to help get the migrants on board to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Up to 750 men, women and children from Syria, Egypt, the Palestinian territories and Pakistan were on board the vessel trying to reach Europe when it sank.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A church service was held on Sunday at the nearby port of Kalamata in memory of the victims. More than 500 people are presumed to have drowned, although only 78 bodies have been recovered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: To date, 104 survivors were rescued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Greek Coast Guard and government officials say their patrol boats and nearby cargo ships had been shadowing the fishing boat after it was spotted by a surveillance plane from Europe's Frontex border agency. They say they offered assistance, but it was rejected by someone on board, the overcrowded trawler.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Violent clashes erupted in the occupied West Bank city of Jenin on Monday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: as Israeli soldiers and Palestinian militants engaged in a bloody standoff.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The confrontation resulted in the deaths of at least three Palestinians, including a 15-year-old boy, while at least 29 others were wounded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Israeli sources say the fighting erupted when soldiers conducting a raid in search of wanted suspects came under fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The incident is the latest in a series of deadly clashes to take place in the West Bank over the past year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Swiss voters have approved a new climate law aimed at slashing fossil fuel use and reaching net zero by 2050.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In a referendum, the legislation received the support of 59% of voters, according to public broadcaster SRF.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The nationalist Swiss People's Party had objected to the government's proposals, saying such measures would cause energy bills to rise. But a campaign by scientists and environmental groups argued the country's melting glaciers would soon vanish completely if greenhouse gas emissions were not reduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: if greenhouse gas emissions were not reduced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Citing national security concerns, Italy has blocked China's Sinochem from extending its control over Milan-based tyre maker Pirelli.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Chinese conglomerate is the largest shareholder in Pirelli, with a 37% stake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The new restrictions imposed by Prime Minister Giorgio Meloni's government will prevent Sinochem from appointing Pirelli's CEO, among other decisions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The government noted concerns about access to sensitive technology, saying that Pirelli's products are of national strategic importance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Spanish rail company Renfe will launch its high-speed trains on the French market on the 13th of July with services between Barcelona and Lyon, followed by Madrid and Marseille on the 28th of July.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The company also has its sights set on Paris and other possible cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since December, only SNCF has been operating between France and Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The French company has ended its links with Renfe to support TGVs, which it's had since 2013.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's seven decades since the Conference of European Rabbis opened its headquarters in London, an alliance of Jewish leaders coming together to support and protect, through political influence, Jewish communities across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But since Brexit, the organization has been looking for a new home. They have now found one and have begun the process of moving to Germany, Munich.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There were a number of raised eyebrows, let's put it that way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Shimon Cohen is a London-based member of the Conference of European Rabbis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He explains the rationale behind the move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: There's a perfectly sensible understanding right across our membership that London was no longer the place to be to have influence in European policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The reality is now it's not going to be the chief rabbi of the United Kingdom that the European Parliament listen to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And therefore we have to be headquartered in part of the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Last month, Bavaria's president, Dr. Markus Söder, at a gathering in Munich, was given an award by the Conference of European Rabbis, in part for having extended the initial invitation to move to the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The Conference of European Rabbis was formed here in London shortly after the end of the Second World War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now, from a purely practical and pragmatic perspective, they've taken the decision to move to Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But for many, it's not just about a political influence, but there's an emotional decision being made too.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Why? Because the destruction of European Jewry started in Munich.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And therefore, it is very symbolic that we are coming back to Munich with the support of the government, and we are in the process of rebuilding European Jewry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The city where Adolf Hitler began his rise to power, generations ago the capital of the Nazi movement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Now once again home to a thriving and influential Jewish movement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, London.
